title: Establishing the White House Task Force on the 2028 Summer Olympics

enrichment.summary: This executive order establishes a White House task force to coordinate and oversee federal planning for the 2028 Summer Olympics, ensuring security, transportation, border safety, and smooth visa processing for participants and visitors. The task force, chaired by the President and supported by multiple federal agencies, will operate until the end of 2028 to facilitate a safe and well-organized Olympic event in the United States.
potential_concerns: The complexity of coordinating multiple federal agencies could lead to bureaucratic delays or inefficiencies in preparation and response.
Security measures might increase surveillance or restrictions affecting civil liberties or raise concerns among privacy advocates.
Visa and credentialing changes could lead to processing backlogs, affecting foreign athletes, officials, and media personnel.
Funding and resource allocation concentrated on the Olympics might divert attention and support from other critical federal programs.
The task force's broad authority and membership could result in unclear accountability or conflicts among agencies.
